subject: Communication
title: When Not to Resolve: Strategic Disengagement
description: A 60-second lesson on When Not to Resolve: Strategic Disengagement.

hook.text: Not every conflict deserves resolution. Some deserve a closed door. Knowing the difference is a superpower.

discovery.text: Strategic disengagement means recognizing when resolution isn't possible and protecting yourself instead.

twist.text: Many conflict resolution books assume good faith on both sides.

climax.text: Boundaries aren't the opposite of conflict resolution. They're its prerequisite. Without them, resolution enables abuse.

punchline.text: Sometimes the bravest resolution is walking away.

quiz.question: When is strategic disengagement appropriate?
options: When the other party acts in bad faith or is abusive
